Name: Pavlov's House
About the game: The goal of Pavlov’s House is to last until the defenders of Pavlov’s House are tasked with storming a key German strongpoint during the Battle of Stalingrad. In the game, this is depicted by playing through a deck of cards representing elements of the German 6th Army. Pavlov’s House was a fortified apartment building used as a strongpoint by the Soviet 62nd Army during the pivotal Battle of Stalingrad in WW2. Soviet defenders – primarily from the 7th Company, 3rd Battalion, 42nd Guards Rifle Regiment of the 13th Guards Division - held out for almost two months from a constant German assault. The building’s name was drawn from Yakov Pavlov, a sergeant who led the initial storm group assault that resulted in the capture of the building from the Germans. The story of Pavlov’s House was a key piece of Soviet propaganda and was used as a symbol of the incredible resistance of Soviet forces during the Battle of Stalingrad. Features - A full recreation of the original board game - Learn the game through an engaging tutorial. - Play against four different levels of difficulty and complexity, from Basic to Elite. - The game takes care of the rules, allowing you to focus on the strategy. - Comprehensive rules and extensive background information is also included. - Make tough decisions, handle the consequences. - Highly replayable and story driven. You’ll never play the same game twice! - An original soundtrack composed by Gabriel Berger.
